oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photograph of "Big Bertha"
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Slightly out-of-focus copy photograph of an enormous mobile artillery piece manufactured by the German company Krupp. Only the barrel is visible. It appears to be mounted on a "disappearing carriage" in a dug in position camouflaged by trees and brush. The picture is labeled "The Grosse Bertha." This is not the long-range gun that bombarded Paris in 1918 which is sometimes erroneously called Big Bertha.
